example: T’as mangé tout ça ? Oh là là tu auras une indigestion! (You ate all that? Oh boy, you’re going to have indigestion.)

tip: Usually followed by oui or non.
example: Ça te plaît ? Ben, pas vraiment.. (You like that? Well, not really…)
Ouf! J’ai failli me cogner sur ce truc là! (Phew! I almost hit myself on this thing here!)

tip: You can use this one to show pain.
example: Aïe ! Ça fait mal! (Ouch! That hurts!)

tip: a familiar or conversational synonym of Quoi ? (What?).
example: Hein ? Qu’est-ce que tu dis? (What? What are you saying?)

tip: Show that something smells, looks, or tastes bad.
example: Beurk! Ce n’est pas bon du tout! (Berk! It’s really not good at all!)

tip: It can denote admiration, anger or astonishment.
example: Zut alors ! J’ai oublié mon porte-monnaie à la maison.(Damn! I forgot my wallet at home.)

tip: This is another very common, typically French interjection that shows mild surprise.
example: Ça alors ! Tu as vu ça? (Wow! Did you see this?)
Mais Enfin ! Ça suffit maintenant! (Come on! That’s enough now!)

tip: this interjection expresses to perfection a sort of laisser-aller (slackness/sloppiness) or depressed indifference
example: Ça t’intéresse d’aller au cinéma ? Bof… pas vraiment. (Are you interested in going to the movies? Meh… not really.)
